snippet: To celebrate 50 years of the spy-movie franchise Metro-Goldwyn-Maye and 20th Century Fox's home entertainment division are releasing a collection containing 22 James Bond movies on Blu-ray.
abstract: To celebrate 50 years of the spy-movie franchise Metro-Goldwyn-Maye and 20th Century Fox's home entertainment division are releasing a collection containing 22 James Bond movies on Blu-ray.
lead_paragraph: If you had to limit yourself to just one James Bond-related purchase for your Q-approved high-end home entertainment system, which would you pick? An early Sean Connery classic like "Goldfinger"? A contemporary Daniel Craig reboot like "Casino Royale"? Or what about a boxed set of nearly every Bond film that's been released over the last half-century? If you fall into that last category (and, presumably, have the financial backing of Her Majesty's government) there will soon be a DVD collection to suit your refined tastes. Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and 20th Century Fox's home entertainment division announced that they are planning to sell a boxed set called "Bond 50," celebrating 50 years of the spy-movie franchise and containing Blu-ray versions of the 22 canonical James Bond films that have so far been released, starting with "Dr. No" (1962).

headline.main: Twenty-Two Is Quite Enough: Comprehensive James Bond Boxed Set Is Planned
